question: Which Indian has recently won the BRICS-Young Innovator Prize?
explanation:
India’s Ravi Prakash has won the BRICS-Young Innovator Prize at 4th BRICS -Young Scientist Forum’s Conclave held during 6-8 November, 2019 in Brazil. He won the first prize carrying $25,000 for inventing an affordable indigenous milk chilling unit for smaller and marginal rural dairy farmers. It can be used for chilling milk from point of production by bringing down the temperature of raw milk from 37 degree Celsius to 7 degree Celsius within half an hour (30 minutes) using nano-fluid based phase change materials.
Ravi Prakash is a PhD scholar of ICAR-National Dairy Research Institute (NDRI), Bangalore. He was a part of 21-member delegation sent to Brazil by Department of Science and Technology (DST) for the 4th BRICS-Young Scientist Forum (YSF), 2019.
